creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: flat, rocky riverbank in foreground; river with a line of boats--two with sails--in middle ground; rising, tree covered hills and bluffs in background
inscription: left margin: 昭和拾七年作　河原 {Shōwa jūshichinen saku, Kawara} | bottom, printed: Tenryu River | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Tenryu River
